comment: Nicest professor I have had at KSU yet! A really sweet person who no one feels intimidated by or afraid to talk to. Her lectures are interesting because she makes sure to add personal experiences to them. I passed all the tests and she even hands out study guides for them beforehand so you know whats coming! (I can recommend 100%! She's awesome!)

Easy class, only 2 papers, 4 exams, maps due about weekly, and attendance is required but only 5% of your grade. She gives study guides for the midterm and final. I recommend really reading the textbook thoroughly to understand the content and read the powerpoints frequently. Easy A if you put forth some effort; fair grader too!

She isn't a terrible teacher if you don't mind her talking from a powerpoint. The slideshows are very long. She mispronounces many things and  gives inaccurate information. She has a sign in sheet for attendance and it's part of the grade. Her tests aren't extremely hard unless you don't go to class or study. They have a lot of info on them

Very easy class to go through and she teaches the criteria  well. She gives out maps to fill out for homework that you can easily do in about 10 minutes, 2 papers that aren't hard, and 4 test, as long as you attend and pay attention in class and go through the power points you should be good !

One of the easiest classes I've taken at college. Professor Moulder isn't exceptional, but she makes everything easy. Attendance is required, maps are required to be turned in about once a month. Not too much homework, easy tests. Two long papers that comprise 15% of your grade each. Boring lectures, but she always makes an effort to let out early.

She assigns lots of reading, but I honestly never even opened the book. As long as you show up for class, do the assigned map homework (takes 10 minutes) every week, review the presentations before the test, and even try a little on the two main essays you'll be golden. She gives a study guide for the midterm and final- EXACTLY LIKE THE TEST.
I had a good time in her class. She is straight forward with her material and the tests are not very hard if you take notes. She is an easy grader which makes the papers a breeze
She is a good teacher! All of her tests are very easy if you do the study guides and review her powerpoints. I enjoyed her a lot! She is very nice

She is very rude to her students and not willing to admit if she makes a mistake. Overall the class is very easy. She requires 2 papers, 2 quizzes, midterm, and a final and she tries to give the opportunity with extra credit. If she wasn't so rude she would be a good teacher.
She's a grandmother figure. No weekly homework. Two quizzes, two tests, two papers. Everything was fairly easy. Very boring class to sit through.

you can tell she her self is very passionate and loves the subject, the only real thing about this class is to do her work, doesn't have to be extraordinary just have to get it done how she layer out for it to be done, oh but she does make mistakes from time to time so she is human... also is understanding that we may make mistakes as well

if you care at all about historical or geographical accuracy, do not take this class.  often she makes 2-3 major blunders per class like counting to 5 instead of 6, or not knowing what OPEC stands for
she cant count to 6, and tends to get her history wrong on everything, if you care about professors being accurate about anything, this class is not for you

Her class is NOT hard. She does make you write a 10 page paper, but it is an easy paper. Pretty much she wants everyone to put in effort. Almost everything was graded more on "completion" rather than "quality". She tells you exactly what she expects from you. Tells you what will be on quizzes and midterms. If anyone didnt make an A or B...Sad
I took Historical Geography, she said that the movie 300 was historically accurate. she requires insane levels of reading and only does midterm and final. 10 page paper with lots of sources.
